title: Dianne Buswell reveals she is still disappointed with Strictly verdict
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin became the latest pair to leave Strictly Come Dancing last weekend, and it looks like she's still devastated about it.

The professional dancer, 30, and her celebrity dancing partner, 34, appeared on It Take Two last night to discuss their eviction.

And this morning Dianne took to Instagram to share some screenshots that gave away how she was really feeling about it all.

In the first picture she pulls a big smile, which fades a little in the second picture, turns into a grimace in the third and is a full on scowl in the last one.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"The disappointment on my face," Diane wrote.

On It Takes Two the pair admitted their shock at being the third couple to be voted off.

Dianne said she promised Dev he was 'going to be fine' because of the judges comments to them earlier in the night.

Both Craig Revel Horwood and head judge Shirley Ballas had initially expressed their complete surprise at Dev even being in the bottom two.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

While all four judges heaped praise on the DJ's red-themed Cha Cha on Saturday night.

Speaking of her continued confusion on It Takes Two, Dianne said: "They gave us great comments. They said the dancing was great. It was just that they wanted him to be a little bit more cheeky in that cha cha.

"I feel like Dev went out there and did exactly what they said."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Dianne was so upset by the decision she couldn't complete the obligatory final dance and pulled out of appearing on the show's podcast with her boyfriend Joe Sugg after filming wrapped.

But the red-head said she hopes it's not over for Dev and she'll continue teaching him if he wants to continue to learn to dance.

"I'm just really, really sad it's over," Dianne told Rylan Clark-Neal.
description: Dianne, 30, shared a string of snaps that showed her smile slowly fading into a scowl as she struggled to hide her feelings
